(1)
Second Ave., east side, between East 99th and 98th Streets, as seen from the 99th Street Station of the Second Ave. Elevated. Shown is the abandoned plant of the Consolidated Gas Company.

August 31, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
A view of the 99th Street side of the old gas plant.

August 31, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

E. 98th Street, west from Second Avenue. View 1 shows the south side; View 2, the north side near Third Avenue; while No. 3 is an inclusive view at a later date. Note in the latter instance, the additional demolitions. Third Avenue appears in the background with its "El" thereupon.

October 20, 1934
Views 1 and 2
View 3: September 14, 1938.

P.L. Sperr

P.L. Sperr

1.
Second Avenue, west side, north from E. 98th to 99th (right) Streets, showing Harlem tenements alternating with clearances. The latter are a direct result of the enforcement of the Tenement House Law requiring minimum conformance. Originally these buildings housed European tenants for whom they were constructed. Today the inhabitants are colored.

September 14, 1938.

P.L. Sperr

2.
2nd Ave. north of 98th St. Neg. A-165

June 19, 1941

P.L. Sperr
